1em 0 1px;overflow-y:hidden;transition:max-height 0.5s ease}#latestnews li{padding-bottom:0.5em;margin-top:0.25em}#latestnews p.item{padding-bottom:0.5em;margin-top:0.25em}#latestnews ul{list-style-type:disc}#footer{text-align:right;margin-right:1em}#credit{float:right;margin-right:0.5em;margin-bottom:0}.hidden{display:none}.v{position:absolute;left:-999em;width:1em;overflow:hidden}#advert,#warning,.advert,.warning,.error-message{border-radius:0.5em;-moz-border-radius:0.5em;-webkit-border-radius:0.5em;padding:0.5em}#advert,.advert{text-align:center;margin:0 auto 0.5em;background-color:#ffcc66;clear:right}#warning,.warning{margin:0 auto 0.5em;background-color:#ffcccc}#warning li,#livedep   <script>
   !function(e,t){"use strict";e.loadCSS=function(e){function n(e){return t.body?e():void setTimeout(function(){n(e)})}function i(){r.addEventListener&&r.removeEventListener("load",i),r.media="all"}var r=t.createElement("link"),o=(t.body||t.getElementsByTagName("head")[0]).childNodes,d=o[o.length-1],a=t.styleSheets;r.rel="stylesheet",r.href=e,r.media="only x",n(function(){d.parentNode.insertBefore(r,d.nextSibling)});var l=function(e){for(var t=r.href,n=a.length;n--;)if(a[n].href===t)return e();setTimeout(function(){l(e)})};return r.addEventListener&&r.addEventListener("load",i),l(i),r}}(this,document);
loadCSS('//traintimes.org.uk/railway2.min.css?1524563184');
document.cookie = 'css=//traintimes.org.uk/railway2.min.css?1524563184;expires="Sat, 19 Sep 2037 12:34:56 GMT";path=/';
  </script>

    <script>
     (function() {
  var d = new Date();
  console.log(("00" + (d.getMinutes() > 45 ? d.getHours()+1 : d.getHours())).slice(-2));
  console.log(("00" + ((Math.ceil(d.getMinutes() / 15) * 15) % 60)).slice(-2));
  document.getElementById('sltHours').value = ("00" + (d.getMinutes() > 45 ? d.getHours()+1 : d.getHours())).slice(-2);
  document.getElementById('sltMins').value = ("00" + ((Math.ceil(d.getMinutes() / 15) * 15) % 60)).slice(-2);
})();
    </script>

  </div>
  <button aria-controls="latestnews" aria-expanded="true" data-a11y-toggle="latestnews" id="about-toggle" type="button">
   About / more information »
  </button>
  <div aria-hidden="false" aria-labelledby="about-toggle" id="latestnews">
   <h2>
    Things of interest
   </h2>
   <ul>
    <li class="news-bit">
     <a href="/live/">
      Live departure boards
     </a>
     ,
using geolocation; or
     <code>
      /live/&lt;station&gt;
     </code>
     . Bookmark! Specify multiple stations by separating them
with a bar “|”.
    </li>
    <li class="news-bit">
     <a href="http://split.traintimes.org.uk/">
      Split ticket finder
     </a>
     ,
for seeing if you can save money by buying multiple tickets for your journey.
    </li>
    <li class="news-bit">
     A
     <a href="/map/">
      vaguely live map of trains
     </a>
     , showing approximate positions
of some trains.
There’s a
     <a href="/map/tube/">
      live Tube map
     </a>
     too.
    </li>
    <li id="news-bittwo">
     <p>
      To insert a live departure board or other page on your own site, put something like:
      <kbd>
       &lt;iframe src="http://traintimes.org.uk/live/brv" width="200" height="300"&gt;&lt;/iframe&gt;
      </kbd>
      in your HTML. The site should automatically adjust for even a very small width display.
     </p>
    </li>
    <li>
     <p>
      <strong>
       Bookmarkable timetable URLs
      </strong>
      : for example,
      <a href="/manchester/edinburgh">
       http://traintimes.org.uk /manchester /edinburgh
      </a>
      will give you the next trains from Manchester to Edinburgh.

“n” or “nearest” for the From will, if possible, ask
you to share your current location to find your current closest station
e.g.
      <a href="/nearest/oxford">
       http://traintimes.org.uk /nearest /oxford
      </a>
      .

You can use a postcode instead of the start or the destination, and it will use the nearest station (and give you two other options including the nearest main station).
     </p>
     <p>
      You can put ?via=NAME or ?avd=NAME at the end of a URL to only show journeys
via/avoiding a particular station. Also, ?chg=NAME or ?nochg=NAME to show
journeys (not) changing at a particular station. Multiple names with commas may
work. Add ?railcard=TYPE to use that railcard prices (options can be seen in the drop-down).
     </p>
     <p>
      Adding a time, like
      <a href="/cardiff/birmingham/8:00">
       http://traintimes.org.uk /cardiff /birmingham /8:00
      </a>
      ,
gives you the timetable starting from there.

A full return journey is of the form
      <a href="/london/leeds/10:00/next-tuesday/16:00/next-wednesday">
       http://traintimes.org.uk /london /leeds /10:00 /next-tuesday /16:00 /next-wednesday
      </a>
      .
     </p>
     <p>
      The time is departure time by default; add an “a”
at the end for arrival time, or use “first” or “last”
for first or last trains.
For example,
      <a href="/london/glasgow/first/tomorrow">
       http://traintimes.org.uk /london /glasgow /first /tomorrow
      </a>
      or
      <a href="/sheffield/liverpool/11:00a">
       http://traintimes.org.uk /sheffield /liverpool /11:00a
      </a>
      .
     </p>
     <p>
      “/changes=0” at the
end of a bookmarkable URL will restrict the
results to direct trains if possible, e.g.
      <a href="http://traintimes.org.uk/birmingham/manchester/changes=0">
       http://traintimes.org.uk /birmingham /manchester /changes=0
      </a>
      .
     </p>
     <!--
<p style="padding-bottom: 1em; margin-top:0.25em">
&ldquo;/overtake=1&rdquo; at the
end of a bookmarkable URL will also include overtaken
trains in the results, e.g.
<a href="http://traintimes.org.uk/brighton/clj/01:00a/saturday/overtake=1">http://traintimes.org.uk /brighton /clj /01:00a /saturday /overtake=1</a>.
</p>
-->
     <p>
      <a href="/brum2london/">
       brum2london
      </a>
      ,
a handy checker for working out what trains to get between Birmingham and London.
     </p>
    </li>
    <li>
     Ian Scott has made a
     <a href="http://www.norcimo.com/fun/mozilla/trainbook.shtml">
      Firefox bookmarklet
     </a>
     . Mark Woodbridge has made a
     <a href="https://gist.github.com/mrw34/5986860">
      Userscript
     </a>
     to change the iCal links to Google Calendar ones.
    </li>
   </ul>
   <p class="footer">
    This is an accessible version of the National Rail Enquiries train timetable site,
giving access to the information on that site no matter what browser you are using,
with no requirement for cookies or JavaScript. It works by screenscraping the information
on the official site, and takes the opportunity to remove the “Please Wait” pages and
move some things around.
Many thanks to National Rail Enquiries for allowing this site to persist.
   </p>
   <p align="right">
    —
    <a href="http://www.dracos.co.uk/">
     Matthew
    </a>
   </p>
  </div>
  <p class="not-tiny" id="footer">
   Kindly hosted by
   <a href="http://www.bytemark.co.uk/">
    Bytemark
   </a>
   <br/>
   <a href="/terms">
    <small>
     Terms and acknowledgements
    </small>
   </a>
  </p>

  </script>

  </script>
